Hotel G Yangon
8.6 Excellent
Based on 26 reviews

Sedona Hotel Yangon
7.9 Very good
Based on 1175 reviews

We got an upgrade to the rooms at the new Inya Wing which were very nice and a steal at the price paid.

That said, the offering at the breakfast buffet was disappointing to say the least, in terms of both taste and spread. Also, the younger wait staff could not understand English, which means you had to wait for a senior staff to get you what you need. There were also a couple of electricity trips during our 1 night stay, but I understand this is commonplace in Yangon. In any case, the electricity came back on within a few short minutes, so it was hardly an inconvenience. Still, considering the price and location, I suppose we will stay at the Sedona the next time round.

Show more
Michelle , Malaysia
Novotel Inle Lake Myat Min Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 83 reviews

When we booked this, there weren't many reviews and we took our chances and we very much enjoyed our stay.

The room we had was fantastic with a great design and super clean and a great view. The staff welcomed us with a refreshing drink upon arrival and were extremely nice and helpful during our entire stay. As mentioned before, they are just learning things but are so great as seen with all Myanmar. We mentioned it was our honeymoon and they offered us free foot massage at the spa which was excellent. We stayed at the resort for 2 nights only, we ordered off the menu twice during our stay and the food was excellent!! The breakfast was good too, with a variety of options. The second night we were staying there, there was an event with a buffet which we also enjoyed. I would say that the prices a bit too high for Myanmar and with no other options around the resort, you're stuck paying those prices. We also booked a car to Red Mountain Winery which was an expensive ride as well. The wifi does not work too well around the hotel. The pool was clean and enjoyable. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend if you are able to afford the bill at the end.

Show more
Negar , Canada
Esperado Lake View Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 618 reviews

I traveled to Myanmar with my family. We stayed in Yangon for 2 nights, flew out to Bagan, then came back to spend one more night in Yangon.

Both times we stayed in Yangon, we stayed at Esperado Lake View Hotel. The hotel is nicely located, easily accessible to taxis where for about $2 you can get to downtown. The rooms were very nice - newly renovated with modern and comfortable facilities. The bathrooms were huge, and the beds and linens were new. The rooms are definitely worth more than we paid. The staff were probably the best thing about the hotel. They were very friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond whatever we asked. We plan to visit Yangon again, and whenever we do, we will be sure to stay in Esperado Lake Hotel.

Show more
MARIA , Philippines
Hotel Accord
8 Very good
Based on 346 reviews

superbe hotel situé dans un quartier un peu éloigné du centre ville. Mais l'hotel est d'une propreté rare, le personnel vraiment génial ( j ai eu la surprise de me voir offrir un gateau d'anniversaire avec toute l'équipe fredonnant le happy birthday to you.

évitez les chambres sur la rue, et préférez celles des derniers étages, ceci dit vous allez passer un séjour vraiment superbe dans cet hotel je vous recommande les suites qui sont de toute beauté! Absolutely amazing hotel, a little bit out of the city center, but who cares? Clean and beautiful! The staff is FANTASTIC; They even thought at my birthday, and I had the surprise to see all team arriving in my room singing happy bday, with a big cake, enough for 4. I you can avoid the rooms on the street, and prefer higher floors. You will absolutely enjoy your stay here, with such a staff. For sure I will return as soon as I go back to Yangon! try the suites that are great! one again thanks to the whole team, never had such a welcome in an hotel before!

Show more
guy , France
Jasmine Palace Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 598 reviews

Very nice hotel good size rooms, well equipped, really comfortable beds with good quality bedding. Good choice of tv channels.

Fantastic gym and nice pool. The only downside is that the rooms are not very well sound proofed. It was unfortunate for us that a "group" were occupying the room next to ours and opposite they were constantly talking to each other in the corridor. Good value hotel though with great staff

Show more
lawrence , United Kingdom
Taw Win Garden Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 861 reviews

The Hotel staff were polite and helpful. The hotel corridor air-con has a musky smell due to the age of the Hotel.

My room is clean and big. There is a supermarket at the basement of the mall; which is located beside the hotel. Money changing is a convenient 5 mins walk down the road with reasonable rates. The Gym is big, helpful staff, clean with full gym equipment.

Show more
Ronald , Singapore
PARKROYAL Yangon Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1469 reviews

I couldn't find a fault in anything. The service is beyond the excellent.. The staff is amazing. Thentu, the manager ( his name is in my notes, will send later) and everyone else made our honeymoon special at parkroyal.

They went out of their way to assist us and make our trip easier. I m a fussy person but this time I'm amazed with the staff and left speechless. We can't thank them enough for their service and everything else. Really recommend this. Actually, it's the staff that make this hotel special and worth every single penny. Thank you, Mr and Mrs patel.

Show more
Ronak , United Kingdom
Best Western Chinatown Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 835 reviews

When we arrive we are happy that all the staff were very helpful and accommodating they help us all the way in arranging tours and guide us to which place to go.

Sad part thing was when we get in to our room it's not clean, there were cloth price tags on the floor and the bathroom is not that clean even the mugs for coffee has lipstick stain, and the bed sheet smells like someone just left the room and there is a stain on the sheet aside from that the room is dusty, we requested for the room to change unfortunately same room has been showed us to select is also untidy and dusty, I even ask the manager to let his staff clean the room and will wait for it to finish, I was thinking of refunding the stay and look for another hotel. The manager was so apologetic and he's even shy showing us diff room but still not clean at all.He then look for a room first and make sure that the room is tidy and clean and esp free from dust as me and my husband had an asthma. Manager insist to upgrade us to a suite I told him that I don't need to be upgraded on a suite just give us a clean room but he insisted as he feel ashamed that the other rooms showed to us were Untidy also. But location and service wise and value for money it's acceptable.

Show more
judy , Hong Kong
Savoy Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 528 reviews

We stayed for 4 nights at the Savoy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The plus points are as follows: - staff are friendly, helpful and go above and beyond.

For example, when we stayed it was during the water festival, they offered to call and check if the restaurants were open and made reservations for us. It was my mothers birthday and they delivered a cake to the room. - rooms are large, clean and comfortable. - bar and restaurant are good and whilst not cheap still affordable. - Breakfast was fantastic. Good selection, service very good and beautiful setting on the terrace.

Show more
Helen , United Kingdom
Melia Yangon
8.7 Excellent
Based on 200 reviews

I spent one night here in June 2017 with my wife and daughter and was booked into a deluxe room. Pros : clean and modern hotel, friendly staff Very good breakfast spread Cons: swimming pool was closed, no valet car parking service ( really surprising!).

Had my room's access cards changed three times before they worked. Breakfast signage is poor, it is spread over a large room and one doesn't really know what is available and where. No one comes over to offer you a morning coffee which I thought is a basic service in every hotel I've stayed in.

Show more
Swaminathan , Australia
Royal Bagan Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1100 reviews

Pleasantly surprised with this hotel, very value for money that we decided to extend our stay one more day.

Location is really good, on the main road but it's quiet, and only a 800m walk to the street with a lot of restaurants. The hotel itself is quite new and the rooms are spacious. The pool seems not too clean though, and small. We paid roughly $25, compared to their walk on rate of $50. At the price we paid, it exceeded all expectations. Breakfast was a small buffet but sufficient, they even offer poached eggs which we liked a lot. The staff is friendly and arranged a car for us, as well as our bus going to Mandalay. However, some patience is needed as they are not as fluent in English. You may have to repeat your sentences. We rented bicycles here as well (they have ebikes for rent too), but they are old Japanese road bikes, and my bike got both brakes broken a few hours in the day. Best to rent bicycles elsewhere. Will definitely recommend.

Show more
Ma , Philippines
Sule Shangri-La, Yangon Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1454 reviews

I stayed in the Sule Shangri-La hotel many times previously and it remains my choice of hotel in Yangon.

The Sule Shangri-La is always clean and in good order. The facilities are all outstanding, including rooms, amenities, WiFi, restaurants, complementary breakfast, happy hour and meeting rooms in the Horizon Club. The staff is professional, courteous and very helpful. I will stay at the Sule Shangri-La highly recommend it to all travelers planning a trip to Yangon.

Show more
Lyn , United States
Blue Bird Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 793 reviews

The hotel is for sure very nice (clean, with a spacious nice rooms and a beautiful swimming pool). Yet, there are many many rules to respect, which make you feel back to school rather than in holidays : - it is not aloud to invite people from outside the hotel to the restaurant of the hotel or the bar (!!) - the swimming pool closes at 7 pm - it is written everywhere that if something goes wrong you will be charged (something broken or stolen, if you smoke in the room the fine is 100 $ etc.

..althoug I understand that you cannot act in a bad way in a hotel, so many rules explicitly written made me feel unconfortable) - and so on;;;.a big big list of rules. Also, the staff does not speak English at all compared to all the other hotels or small restaurants we went to, which is surprising for a nice hotel like this one. Location is not ideal as it is just outside new bagan (far from most temples and you must walk at least 20 min to find a place for diner if not having diner at the hotel). However, the hotel is quiet and beautiful and although the staff does not speak English, they are really kind and do their best. Would not come back due to the numerous rules which made me feel unconfortable Cloyes-sur-le-Loir

Show more
Aude , France
Chatrium Hotel Royal Lake Yangon
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1278 reviews

All the information, including directly from the front desk, states that it is easily walkable to the Shwedagon Pagoda.

While I did make the walk it was quite a bit longer than I was lead to believe (approx 2.3km) and having to cross a couple of very big dangerous intersections on foot. They are building a foot bridge over one main road, but it is not open yet. Other disappointment was the lack of any Myamar food on the menu and the really awful breakfast. Coffee was not drinkable and the "warm" dishes were just barely. Other breads and pastries were awful. The staff were lovely, helpful and the lobby, grounds are nice.

Show more
Tommy , United States
Zfreeti Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1138 reviews

Wanted to treat myself for my birthday so I picked Zfreeti. Paid about $68 a night 2/17-2/20. Pros: nyaung u is a cute area, 7min by ebike (scooter) to ananda pagoda.

Two block away is restaurant lane with about 20 restaurants. All very similar but thats all in Burma. Pool must need for hot bagan days, special treat for us. Food at the hotel was not too expensive, example $4 for fried rice. Happy hour 2 for 1 drinks at $3. Staff super attentive and willing to get things done as fast and right as possible. Room is spacious and have a refrigerator, a plus. Buffet breakfast good choices with similar options for the three days we were there. Average taste. But had several types of juices, milk, tea and coffee. Negative: the bathroom shower, like other reviews. Once you showered expect your entire bathroom to be wet, last day flood about 2 inch of water slow drain. If they just used another 16 inches of glass as a divider from shower to bathroom it would be fine.

Show more
priscilla , United States
Rose Garden Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 151 reviews

This is a huge hotel which offers big clean rooms and bathrooms, a large breakfast selection and good wifi.

All staff are very friendly and helpful. Good central location and taxis are easy to pick up and cheap. Don't book a taxi collection from the airport through the hotel as it's much more expensive, just pick one up easily at the airport (there's a taxi counter just at the arrivals gate). Breakfast and other meals are fine and what you'd expect. Pool area is lovely but more sun loungers are needed.

Show more
emily , United Kingdom
Kandawgyi Palace Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 351 reviews

The hotel is located just minutes away from the Schwedagon Paya, which is a must in Yangon. it is also only a 10 minutre drive away from the centre of town.

While rooms have nice views of the lake and while staff attentiveness and service cannot be flawed, the hotel could do with a facelift as rooms are looking dated and tired. Also what was most annoying for us was the really strong smell of pesticide present in the room. My clothes and bags were impregnated with the smell even days after we had left the hotel. The pool didn't look that appealing as it was dead in the middle of what could only be described as a bit of rainforest (dinosaur included). Might also add that me and my friend ended up with an upset stomach after having dinner at the hotel... From that point on i stayed away from the included free breakfast. Overal the hotel was ok for a couple of nights stay, but I'd probaly look to stay in a different place if i went back.

Show more
Chris , United Kingdom
Novotel Yangon Max
8.5 Excellent
Based on 107 reviews

I stayed for 2 nights when I visited Yangon for a business purpose. Room is clean and comfortable. It was better if they have a bath tub.

What I liked the most about the room was bed. Staff was cheerful and very helpful. Enjoyed the buffet at the breakfast. Though it is a bit away from downtown area, I definitely recommend this hotel for the stay in Yangon.

Show more
YUI , Japan
Hotel Yadanarbon Bagan
8 Very good
Based on 466 reviews

The hotel was fine given that the reason to be in Bagan is visit as many ancient temples as you can, not to hang out in your hotel room.

Ours was 2 twins, with the usual useless bedside lighting (a pet peeve of ours). The bathroom was ok, with a very tall tub you had to climb into to take a shower and very odd small shelf mounted on the wall directly over the faucet so that you had to work your hand under the shelf to turn the water on and off. Not a big deal once you figured out the technique, but a strange set up given that there was plenty of other space to put stuff in the shower. We seemed to be there during renovation time because there was relentless banging, pounding, buzzing, and drilling on the roof above us. And the last day we were there, when we thought we would try the lovely pool, it was closed to lay new tiles around it. Presumably these aren't regular events. The staff were lovely and very helpful. We rented an Ebike from them on 2 of our days there and highly recommend it for scooting around to see as many temples as possible. The breakfast was not as good as the Yadanarbon in Mandalay, where we had just spent the previous 4 nights, but ok (plain white bread instead of lovely little croissants and a meager selection of fresh fruit). The coffee, however, was undrinkable.

Show more
James , United States
Lotte Hotels & Resorts Yangon
8.6 Excellent
Based on 19 reviews

Inya Lake Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 997 reviews

The hotel and the staff were very good. We had booked the hotel for 2 adults and 2 children. Thankfully the comments also read the same.

Our hotel voucher we received from Agoda mentioned the booking for only 1 person. The staff was very kind to accommodate our entire family without additional charge. We had to pay a few dollars for one breakfast. We later learned from the hotel that they had similar cases in the last few days. The rooms are big. The look like old colonial rooms- high ceiling, basic bathrooms, etc. Good hotel as it is close to the lake.

Show more
Sumitra , India
Sky View Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 372 reviews

This hotel was situated a bit far from the bars and restaurants at Nyaung-U and even further from the main Bagan area, but that is not necessarily a bad thing.

E-bikes are readily available and cheap enough and provide a good means of transportation to get around. The breakfast on the roof was enjoyable with good views of the balloons, but the food a bit bland for my tastes. I ordered lunch from the kitchen upon my arrival and it was pretty dismal. After that, all other meals were eaten off property. The staff spoke good English and were very helpful. The room was big and clean. Overall, a pleasant stay at this hotel.

Show more
Norman , United States
Super Hotel Yangon Kabar Aye Road
8.4 Excellent
Based on 329 reviews

This is my 2nd time in this hotel. It very basic but has everything you need for short trips (a few nights), with a very affordable price.

The food for me, is pretty authentic Japanese. Onsen is great for relaxing at night or for a good start of the day. The room was improved from the last time I was there. The hotel added a lazy boy chair, with electronic reclining control, for you to sit comfortably while watching TV. It is something not all hotels thing about. With my USB filled with TV Series, my time in the room was well spent. Only draw back in this hotel is there is no room service and food cannot be charged to the room. Food is pay are you order from the downstairs Jap Resto. Overall, despite the drawback, which can easily be dealt with my taking the food upstairs yourself, it was a well managed hotel, very clean and good authentic Jap Food.

Show more
John , Philippines
Clover City Center Plus Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 1702 reviews

Located on probably the ugliest street in downtown Yangon (and the competition is fierce), City Clover Plus offers surprisingly high standard, including spacious, clean rooms and smart staff.

If possible, opt for higher floors to avoid wall view. Stable wi-fi in the rooms, hot water, convenience stores and eateries around, short distance to more friendly district between Secretariat and the river, posh restaurants and shops of Pansodan Str. etc.

Show more
Joanna , Poland
Hotel Yankin
7.4 Very good
Based on 328 reviews

Whilst the standard room is small it is functional despite difficulty with bathroom door striking end of bed.

(Poor room layout design) Great air conditioner, television and bathroom facilities. (Hot and cold shower outlets) Bed small but clean and comfortable perfect for the single traveller, Wif fi was of good speed and reliability. Hotel staff were polite friendly and helpful. Whilst hotel is in Yankin Town just outside of Yangon CBD the main centre is easily accessed via cheap taxi cabs. Breakfast was buffet and very good value added to room. Asian and european cuisine. Area has few shops of interest to tourists with exception of Seven Star Cafe a short distance away which does passable coffee and good general snack food. Thoroughly recommend for single tourist traveller. Will personally use hotel again.

Show more
David , United Kingdom
Summit Parkview Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 799 reviews

We found the hotel was a short distance by cheap taxi, to Pagodas, Yangon and lakes. Situated in a quiet area, with some good restaurants nearby, this spotlessly clean and comfortable hotel was well priced.

The staff were very professional and friendly. Especially the barman Oo Tan. The food in the hotel was good and catered to a wide selection. Breakfast has been criticised in the past, but again a wide variety of tastes were catered for with fresh dhosas, prathas and eggs cooked on request along with Chinese, Korean and European cuisines available. The cakes, bread and pastries were light and fresh. My particular favourite was the local noodle dish.

Show more
David , United Kingdom
Hotel Grand United Ahlone Branch
7.9 Very good
Based on 1226 reviews

I have been staying at Hotel Grand United for more than 5 trips over 5 months. However, I had some disappointment during my last 2 bookings at Grand United.

I had a late check in after arrival (at about 7pm) and the Dulexe room I booked for was no longer available. I was given another type of room or with single beds, or smoking room, etc. However, this time round, after I made the complaint, they upgraded me to the Penthouse for my stay. I thought it was a good service recovery they did and did not change my room during my 4 nights stay with them.

Show more
Janie , Singapore
The Hotel @ Tharabar Gate
8.5 Excellent
Based on 519 reviews

We were stayin at the hotel for 1 night after Lake Inle. Hotel is very well located, right next to all temples.

Hotel rents bikes out that you can use to move from temple to temple, however renting outside the hotel is at least 30% cheaper. Decor of the hotel was a bit tired and dated. However it was very clean with large rooms. English speaking staff was very helpful. We thought hotel restaurant was very overpriced and didn't eat there. There are many local places within a 3 min walk. Try Star Beam - fantastic salads. Pool was very average. Breakfast was good, had all necessities. This hotel is a true 3&1/2 star. Form your expectations objectively - it's in Bagan in Myanmar, there won't be four seasons five star available. I also hope if anyone is in bagan - they don't spend much time in the hotel, there is more then enough to see. Sunset was a highlight of our trip.

Show more
Valeriya , Canada
Aureum Palace Hotel & Resort
8.3 Excellent
Based on 45 reviews

The nature alone surrounding this hotel is deserving of its 5 star listing. Beautiful serene water, lush greenery, abundant variety of plant life all provide a sense of calm and peace and makes for a magnificent view out onto your hotel room.

Highly recommend to stay in the floating duplex, as its unique architectural design gives the feeling of sleeping in a boat, but without any worries of the seasickness that may occur. The amenities in the room were new and provided a nice 5 star quality touch. I loved the unique bathtub and shower design. Personally had experienced no issues with the water temperature or pressure, as some reviewers mentioned. The food was absolutely delicious and exceeded any expectations. The dinner choices on the menu provided enough local cuisine dishes which was quite a joyous surprise however the breakfast choices were all European style which was disappointing (save for 1 local noodle soup dish each morning which was excellent!). Would recommend to try the local red wine, as it was very good quality. There were only 2 points which may put in doubt its 5 star listing and they would be the wifi availability that was minimal and slow, and the spa service which was average at best. However, aside from these 2 points, the stay was superb and would definitely return and recommend to everyone.

Our taxi driver woke someone up and they immediately put us in a comfy bedroom to let us sleep until the later morning when our room would be free. Breakfast was very good, with huge avocados, coffee, toasts, jam and eggs. The room is clean, spacious and in good overall conditions. I will definitely stay again there when I go back to Inle!

Show more
celine , France
Bike World Myanmar Bed, Breakfast & Bike Inn
8.9 Excellent
Based on 210 reviews

The traffic in Yangon is beyond shocking and getting to/from the downtown sights is an effort, but we would recommend Bike World to anyone.

Great people and service, comfy rooms, very secure. Breakfast included was comprehensive, fresh and tasty. Homemade pizza and cheap, cold beers available in the evening. Be aware that getting downtown is not a matter of jumping on a borrowed bike. It's too far and the roads are very unsafe, even to cross (think Extreme Frogger). Instead a trishaw (rickshaw) to the train station and the slow train to town is recommended and a very worthwhile experience. If taking taxis around town, be prepared for long journeys and choked roads. Bike World is well-situated to airport and bus stations. Inya Lake is nearby, a short walk, and a quiet day relaxing here in the restaurants is sweet relief from the madness of downtown Yangon. Thank you once again for a great stay.

Travis , Australia
Lotus Bed And Breakfast
8.6 Excellent
Based on 257 reviews

Although the taxi driver got a little hard time finding the hotel but overall, we had a nice stay. If you take taxi, tell the driver to go to Mahabandoola Road, 49th Street and the hotel is at the right sideof the road.

The location is great too, walking distance to Sule Pagoda. When we stayed, there was a renovation going on on the next door room but the work stops at 6 and we barely in the room before it's over so, no biggie for us. The breakfast was amazing (try the Myanmar Traditional Food) and the staff showed a great support, willing to do everything to make your stay comfortable. There is a cafe right across the hotel (Black Sky - if I'm not mistaken) and try the tom yum there. Tasty! There is also a small shop under the hotel (with a super polite owner) so you can buy anything you want from there.

Show more
Rembulan , Indonesia
Soe Ko Ko Beach House & Restaurant
7.8 Very good
Based on 116 reviews

I would rate the Soe Ko Ko better, would they not have chosen to increase their prices during Water Festival by more than 300%: the bungalows are very basic, never worth the 95 US$ we paid, and the extra bed was nothing more but a thin mattress on the floor, without even a blanket! The bathroom was clean, but water on the floor would not evacuate… The bungalows are located a 5 minutes walk away from the beach, but unfortunately directly on the road, with traffic noise early mornings, hardly absorbed by the thin bamboo walls.

On the positive side: the staff is very friendly and they seriously try to be helpful, offering us on the first night of arrival beds, so that we could rest until our room was ready. I wish however they would be more reliable when you order a service (in our case motorbikes): they confirmed several times that there would be no problems, but then somehow forgot about it… All in all: a decent choice if you get it at a good price, but outside the peak days of Water Festival, I guess you could find more attractive places for the same price...

Richard , Switzerland
The Vibe Inn
8.4 Excellent
Based on 84 reviews

Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, good breakfast, small lounge area on the top floor and a good location make the Vibe a great base in Yangon.

Chinatown on the doorstep, minor train station a walk away and taxis elsewhere just 100 yards away on strand road (although the staff will happily fetch one and agree a reasonable price for you). We have stayed here a few times over our time in Myanmar, it's great to have a nice base at a reasonable price in Yangon. One star knocked off this review for facilities - it would be lovely if there was a lift, as getting to the top floor in Yangon heat can be a bit much... such a minor point at this price, but it's the only thing I can think of that isn't positive. rooms have AC as does the lounge, so at least you can cool down when you get up the stairs. Thanks Vibe, see you in a couple of weeks.

Geraint , United Kingdom
New Wave Guest House
7.6 Very good
Based on 81 reviews

Old building with no heat( nights are really cold) mold in the bathroom walls, water is coming thru the floor tiles on couple of places.

The staff was diligent but their standards must be not very high. I felt that it was overpriced for what it was considering next door locations are 15$ a night. The pillows are the worst. Have no idea why but my neck is just killing me after 4 nights there. If I didn't prepay I would have left after the first night. On the bright side the staff was really eager to help.

Stoyan , United States
Nature Land Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 153 reviews

Nature Land is a great place to stay in Kalaw - it's in the perfect location, just off the beaten path, in a residential area (so you feel a bit like a local).

Close to all the trekking and tour offices, but with a quick phone call a rep will come to you and discuss a possible route. Close to all the market and all the restaurants as well. The staff and owners were really friendly and helpful. They even booked our bus tickets to Inle Lake and drove us to the bus stop the day we left. The complimentary breakfast was great and served each morning at their al fresco tables around the property. The grounds and room were clean and well maintained. We had an issue with the hot water on our second night, but as soon as we told the staff they fixed the problem.

Cassaundra , United States
Sakura Inn
9 Excellent
Based on 4 reviews

A Little Eco Lodge
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 12 reviews

Thanlwin Guest House
8.7 Excellent
Based on 187 reviews

Thanlwin was ok... I felt as though it was a bit of a splurge at over $20 for a night there. I stayed in the dormitory, which was standard.

It's pretty small, but they provide lockers big enough for a pack. The best part of the place was there are many showers to accommodate all the guests. (only one inside the building, then a number additional bathrooms in the back). All the showers had hot water (electric). The weird thing was that when I was showering they kept having power outages. Don't know what that was about. But the staff is really friendly and helpful. The location is behind Sedona Hotel. It's a bit hard to find at first. It's nice if you want some quiet time and a really chill vibe.

Jasmine , United States
Six Star Guest House
8.5 Excellent
Based on 16 reviews

Hill Garden Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 218 reviews

Was my first stop in Myanmar and I think I may be spoiled for the rest of my travels! Its a short 5 min, beautiful bike ride (bikes are available for about $2 a day at the hotel) along the ocean to arrive at the main beach.

The sister hotel is located at the main beach and you are welcome to use the Free Wifi there. Your price includes a very good breakfast - you're given the fruit of the day, treat of the day (local sweet, very good so you should try them all), coffee or tea, your choice of eggs and toast, selection of pancakes or for a day notice you can enjoy a Myanmar traditional dish (listed on the menu, I cannot rem how to spell it), which I recommend, its delicious. There is a man that works between the two hotels relentlessly to ensure you are taken care of each day of your stay. He arranges transportation, trips, tours, extensions - you name it, he's fantastic! The only downside to this hotel for me was how long it took to get hot water to my hut. Depending on where yours is located it can take upwards of 15 mins plus. Though cool showers are quite normal in Asia and often welcomed after a very hot day of travel, so not the end of the world in my opinion.

Eileen , Canada
Agga Guest House
7.3 Very good
Based on 580 reviews

I had booked a single room but brought another friend with me. Unfortunately there was no upgrades available but they had sister hotel available around the corner for a bartered price similar to what I payed.

The rooms were nice and WIFI good compared to the rest of Myanmar. It was a 20-30 minute walk all the way down to Sule Pagoda and the rest of downtown but there were many local buses to take you there and it was only minutes walk to the famous 19th st. and all of the nightlife of China Town. Breakfast is similar to Vietnam hostels. 2 pieces of bread with eggs and Jam. Much better than most Thai hostels with just toast and jelly. Just don't ask the workers to help get you taxi to bus station or Airport. They get taxi and negotiate price higher than usual so they can get kickback from driver.

Dennis
Inle Inn
8.7 Excellent
Based on 101 reviews

We stayed three nights with my husband in this hotel. Overall its a good hotel and we were satisfied.

The room was clean big and the bed comfortable. The breakfast was good in term of quality but small and with only two choices (eggs or pain cakes). The hotel location is a bit outside but its maybe a 10min walk or 5min with the bike taxi (for app 1 $) so it was not a problem for us. The only bad point was the price of the laundry, it was extremely expensive... The most expensive prices we have had in Myanmar (and we stayed there 4weeks). The staff was friendly.

Mr Charles River View Lodge
9.1 Exceptional

Our stay at river lodge was amazing. The location near a Shan village is peaceful and relaxing. The food is delicious (try the brown sticky rice).

The staff was very kind and Mimi, the daughter of Mr Charles, helped us organizing our trip in Myanmar. This is the best hotel and location in Hsipaw and we hope to come back soon.

Emilie , Italy
Agga Bed & Breakfast
7.6 Very good
Based on 133 reviews

I stayed in a 8-bedroom dorm that I was really satisfied with. This room has no bunkbeds so everyone gets their own bed, which was quite big and comfy.

You also get a fairly big locker and if you don't have a lock they can supply you with a key. Breakfast is fairly simple - eggs on toast, but it's enough to keep you going until lunch. The dining area is also quite nice. The staff are nice and accommodating and they will help you with everything. You can also use their printer for a cheap price. Wifi here is one of the best I had throughout Myanmar.

Hannah , Norway
20th Street Hostel
7.6 Very good
Based on 246 reviews

We arrived at the hostel earlier and couldn't check-in until 2PM. They were fully booked. The common toilet and showers in the second floor were quite dirty and old.

I was very uncomfortable with this. When we finally checked in, we stayed in one of the dorm rooms which was actually very nice, clean and cozy. The bathroom in that room was very clean and neat. Breakfast was really good as they served local food and they were generous with the amount of food. The hostel's location is very convenient as it is in China Town and it was very near the long stretch of food vendors at night. Aircon was our saving grace as well. Yangon heat during our stay was unbearable.

Show more
Isabel , Philippines
Mother's Home Motel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 104 reviews

The staff here was very nice and very friendly. I was jet-lagged when I arrived and couldn't sleep even after checking in quite late.

I went downstairs to have a cigar and a beer but realized that I never packed a lighter or matches. The gentleman working that night didn't have a lighter or matches but was nice enough to start the car outside so I could use it's lighter. He then brought out a chair and a table for me and even brought me some fruit. This was my welcome to Myanmar. The hotel is on a pretty rough street that will be a shock to anyone unfamiliar with the third world. There is also a lot of traffic noise. The power went out constantly which is not the hotel's fault. They do have a backup generator but the constant cycling and beeping from the a/c coming back on-line made sleep tough especially with the jet-lag to deal with. The staff arranged a flight for me and my friend and helped with places to eat in the area and taxi rides. We also got them to write the name and address of the hotel in Burmese to show cab drivers when returning from sightseeing or eating out.

Frank , United States
Mya Thida Hotel
6.7 Good
Based on 535 reviews

It was a little stressful when we first arrived at Mya Thida. The bus dropped us off in Bagan ~4am and after viewing the sunrise atop a temple, we were dropped off at the guest house around 6:30 am.

The staff was clearly overwhelmed by the large (by the hotel's capacity standards) group that ascended at such an early hour (though I think it was fairly typical considering the popularity of overnight buses in Myanmar). My partner & I were the only ones with a reservation (booked through Agoda) though we were the last of the bunch to be accommodated. Apparently the type of room we booked was the last to become available/cleaned. The internet connection was also terrible - so slow that we weren't able to even book a stay in the next city we were traveling to. All in all, the place was nicely located & the rooms were clean and comfortable by our standards.

Mr Charles Guest House

My stay there was absolutely fine apart from te fact I was unfortunate enough to have a room where the common area was right outside.

Despite there being a notice for quiet time after 10pm, one group totally disregarded this and were super loud and playing music until nearly 1am which meant I couldn't sleep, despite knowing I was in my room. Guess I could've gone out and asked them to be quiet, but I couldn't trust myself to be civil...! The next night was fine. The staff are lovely and helpful, and the ability to easily book hikes and buses etc easily was great. The toilets & shower were too far away, downstairs and outside in another block, but not the end of the world given I had my own little room (sparse but clean & did the job) for a very good price. Would recommend to other travellers

That said, the offering at the breakfast buffet was disappointing to say the least, in terms of both taste and spread. Also, the younger wait staff could not understand English, which means you had to wait for a senior staff to get you what you need. There were also a couple of electricity trips during our 1 night stay, but I understand this is commonplace in Yangon. Show more Michelle , Malaysia Novotel Inle Lake Myat Min Hotel 8.9 Excellent Based on 83 reviews When we booked this, there weren't many reviews and we took our chances and we very much enjoyed our stay. The room we had was fantastic with a great design and super clean and a great view. The staff welcomed us with a refreshing drink upon arrival and were extremely nice and helpful during our entire stay. As mentioned before, they are just learning things but are so great as seen with all Myanmar. We mentioned it was our honeymoon and they offered us free foot massage at the spa which was excellent. We stayed at the resort for 2 nights only, we ordered off the menu twice during our stay and the food was excellent!! The breakfast was good too, with a variety of options. The second night we were staying there, there was an event with a buffet which we also enjoyed. I would say that the prices a bit too high for Myanmar and with no other options around the resort, you're stuck paying those prices. We also booked a car to Red Mountain Winery which was an expensive ride as well. The wifi does not work too well around the hotel. The pool was clean and enjoyable. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend if you are able to afford the bill at the end. Show more Negar , Canada Esperado Lake View Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 618 reviews I traveled to Myanmar with my family. We stayed in Yangon for 2 nights, flew out to Bagan, then came back to spend one more night in Yangon. Both times we stayed in Yangon, we stayed at Esperado Lake View Hotel. The hotel is nicely located, easily accessible to taxis where for about $2 you can get to downtown. The rooms were very nice - newly renovated with modern and comfortable facilities. The bathrooms were huge, and the beds and linens were new. The rooms are definitely worth more than we paid. The staff were probably the best thing about the hotel. They were very friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond whatever we asked. We plan to visit Yangon again, and whenever we do, we will be sure to stay in Esperado Lake Hotel. But try Swim Pool! But who care very clean environment guests, have to think again. Everything built by wooden at the top of the mountain in Popa, Myanmar(Half year have raining... wild forest...) But we enjoyed a lot & will visit again in Cool season around Dec-Jan. Show more Ju , South Korea Inle Princess Resort 8.9 Excellent Based on 124 reviews What an idyllic hotel, this is probably one of the most amazing places I have stayed. The location lakeside is beautiful, tranquil and best enjoyed from your own private terrace in the lakeside chalets furnished with sun loungers and comfy chairs with footrests. Whilst the location certainly adds to the charm of this hotel the attention to detail at this hotel is incredible. Wonderful cabins with outdoor showers, charming clay fires lit every night as the evening chill sets in, binoculars to observe the lake wildlife, flowers decorating the bed and bathroom, fresh fruit the list is endless. Venture outside your heavenly chalet and the rest of the resort is equally amazing and staffed with wonderfully helpful, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Reception are happy to help with any little request, information on sightseeing, cycling trips, etc. After sun down head for the bar exquisitely decorated and with friendly and efficient staff before enjoying the restaurant with fabulous Asian and western food although it tends to be a little formal. A wonderful 5 night stay here made even better by the staff who made us so welcome. Show more Sarah , United Kingdom Royal Nadi Resort by Phyu Zin Group of Hotels 8.5 Excellent Based on 36 reviews We had a great two night stay at the Royal Nadi Resort. Perfect for some peace and quiet after a long day sight seeing. The staff are helpful and polite - especially as we arrived from our over night bus at 4am! The rooms are large, clean and have everything you'd need. The surroundings are stunning, especially for a little sun downer cocktail or two to watch the sunset over the mountains. Bikes are available for free to cycle into town and the surrounding areas - about 20 minutes to town. Very glad we stayed here rather than in the centre of town amid all the chaos and dust, and would recommend to others. Only slight disappointment was that the spa was not available, which would have been welcomed after spending the night on an uncomfortable mini bus! Also, the wifi barely worked, and only in the reception area - I hope this is something they can work on! Show more Chloe , Singapore Emerald Sea Resort 7.9 Very good Based on 252 reviews We had a beachfront bungalow which was absolutely perfect. The beach wonderful and practically deserted. The room was spacious even with 2 extra beds for the kids. The food in the restaurant was very good, too. The breakfasts were ok - a limited choice but everything fresh and tasty. The dinners (we ate there twice) were a real feast - plenty of food, best quality and top class service. The staff in the hotel was just outstanding: the rooms cleaned twice a day, housekeeping coming in the evening to spray the rooms with anti-mosquito and bring some evening treat (a fruit or a cake), restaurant staff very well trained and professional, everybody extremely helpful and always smiling. Thank you very much - we had a truly wonderful stay! Show more Patrick , Poland Inle Lake View Resort & Spa 8.7 Excellent Based on 89 reviews This place deserves to be five star resort, it is in a beautiful location with views from many rooms across Inle Lake. I got a reasonably priced room but was upgraded due to it being low season and had a junior suite. Staff were delightful always smiling and always plenty of service when you wanted it. A nice touch was that when i arrived back in the afternoon a staff member would quickly track me down wherever I was with a welcome back smoothly. Food in the restaurant was really good and the massage at the spa also excellent. Food and services are a bit pricey as they are clearly aiming at a fairly high end market. Possibly my only criticism is the lack of wifi in rooms. A great resort for couples. Breakfast is included in room price and it is very good. Show more Steven , Australia Myanmar Treasure Resort 8.8 Excellent Based on 29 reviews Aureum Palace Hotel & Resort 9.5 Exceptional Based on 12 reviews The Eternity Resort 8.6 Excellent Based on 304 reviews Our group of 12 stayed for a night after visiting the Golden Rock and everyone was more than pleased. The hotel was fairly new looking and most importantly well kept and CLEAN! It's a much better hotel option than staying at the hotels on the mountain (in my opinion). The bathrooms/shower was clean as well. It was a great value. Dining: Great customer service, but then again we were the only ones in the dining hall for dinner...Only issue was that the food took forever to come out. They also offer free breakfast in the morning. Our group was departing really early in the morning so we requested if breakfast could be made available an hour earlier than normal and they made it happen. Now that was great service! Very accommodating. Location: Was tough to find initially, but our drivers just asked locals and we found our way. The walk from the truck stop was less than 10 minutes. I'm really glad we chose the Eternity Resort. I definitely recommend it to future travelers visiting the golden rock. Show more Cassandra , United States Merciel Retreat & Resort Ngapali 7.7 Very good Based on 75 reviews It is a very beautiful hotel with so much potential to be a 4-5 star hotel but they somehow miss upholding the standard. . The hotel is not even a year old and still the furniture in the rooms looks really old and battered. That is such a shame, we were really looking foward having a nice time in this hotel but the cleaning was really disappointing, even after we said that the bathroom was covered in mold, and the floor was not cleaned wet once there wasnt so much improvement. They removed the mold but still the bathroom was smelly.. This hotel could be so much more... They should also try to clean up the swimming pool... And the breakfast in the morning was super cold.. I hope they realize how much potential this hotel has and try tp improve their mistakes.. Otherwise people wont visit anymore... Show more Natalia , Germany Bay of Bengal Resort 8.1 Excellent Based on 97 reviews Nwessaung is very nice village, more and more resort are implanting and we are changing everytime we come. I guess we will change again next time... The hotel is nice, location perfect, a bit out from the village but you can walk or take motorbike. The beach is nice even if it would be better to clean it some time. Anyway, my major concern was from the staff, they are nice but need to improve their experience with foreigners. For example, when we put the signal "do not disturb" in front of our entrance door it means we don't want anybody to knock at our door at 7am, we want to relax !! Also some noise from the street if you take garden view room and sometime they make sono test which can be annoyion if you have the seaside view appartment... Show more Aurelien , France Myanmar Treasure Resort 8.9 Excellent Based on 15 reviews Aquarius Inn 8.5 Excellent Based on 871 reviews The Aquarius Inn is a small, family run B & B style hotel, the staff are charming and very friendly. It has a pretty garden where breakfast is served and is a good communal area to meet and chat with fellow travellers. We booked a superior room that was a good size with twin beds, fridge/mini bar, TV, en-suite shower/toilet, all cleaned daily. It also had a private balcony, which was ideal place to sit and chill. I travelled with my daughter, and we both found it a very comfortable hotel for female travellers to stay. It is in a good location, away from the hustle and bustle of the main streets, but still within easy walking distance. It is close to the jetties for the boats and has plenty of restaurants nearby. Show more Ann , United Kingdom Shwe Na Di Guest House 8.3 Excellent Based on 652 reviews Pros: wifi good speed. Scooter rentals at 6,000k, water at 300k. Cheap price for October, booked 2 twin beds for 2 and received a 3 twin bed room upstairs on top of breakfast room. Nice and quiet! Breakfast every morning usually same items: banana, watermelon (fruit), white toast with strawberry or pineapple jam, oj, coffee, tea, a scrambled egg served like a pancake. The variation is we had Chinese donut then samosas another day. Has JJ express free bus shuttle service. Staff are SUPER friendly and hospitable, so helpful with everything. Cons: shared bathroom facilities include bathroom has 3 toilets, 1 squatter, 3 showers, 3 outside sinks. 2 showers have red lights in them and open windows in all making a creepy shower experience if ur not used to that. Two showers have hooks to hang stuff, one doesn't = inconvenient. Sometimes there's a line to use the toilets, sinks or showers. Hostel is along the road makes for a dusty reception area. Overall great convenient place to stay! Show more Jessica , United States Backpacker Bed & Breakfast 8.6 Excellent Based on 486 reviews I stayed for 1 night and booked to stay again before leaving. The staff were very helpful with information and booking a bus an onward bus ticket for me. Breakfast was on the top floor which had a nice view of the city. There were different options either Asian style or the usual fruit eggs and toast. I had a room to myself which was on a floor with low ceilings and no windows but it was quiet and comfortable. The wifi worked very well the time I was there. There were plenty of street food options as well as shops to get snacks or drinks nearby. Show more Hans , Canada YAMA Dormitory Guest House 8.9 Excellent Based on 182 reviews I come to Myanmar several times, but always have the problem such as "very old building", "No connection of Internet". .. And as time goes by, the hotel prices getting too much high comparing their quality. At that time, I found this place. Newly built. Good atmosphere. And VERY fast internet (in this country). Only issue is that they have only easy breakfast, toast and serial. But for this price I can say that it is fare price, in my opinion. Show more ikuma , Japan Northern Breeze Guest House 8.4 Excellent Based on 323 reviews Bed was really comfortable, the hotel was vclean and the staff was great -They would listen to our requirement during breakfast and were super attentive! The only reason I don't give a 10 score for this guest house is due to a problem we had: the drain in the shower area was clogged so the water would stay in a pool around the rocks and there were many water flies reproducing in there and flying into our room. I am not sure why this was not reported before... Once we complained the drain was unclogged (unfortunately the flies still remained around). Our room also had blood marks on the wall of Mosquitos that were previously killed and were still stuck on the wall. We thought this was a bit gross, but again we think for the price paid this was a great place to stay. Show more Giselle , Brazil Golden Rose Guest House 8 Very good Based on 75 reviews Triple room on the third floor clean and enough. when we arrived we were annoyed by a strong smell from the kitchen which was just next to our room but finally for the next days it was ok. a bit overpriced for what it is, but that's Bagan maybe. didnt like the local food for breakfast -almost all tasted like fish. the egg and toast breakfast was ok. nice garden rooftop for breakfast. ebikes were cheaper in the hotel next door (6000kyat instead of 8000). staff friendly. but didn't clean the room even when I asked for it. but allowed early check-in. Good location to visit Bagan and Nyaung oo. not that many restaurants close to the hotel. Show more Constanze , Germany Hillock Villa 9.1 Exceptional Based on 24 reviews Soe Brothers II Guest House 6.9 Good Based on 143 reviews I arrived at 6:30 am after a night bus from Inle Lake, and decided to join the all day cave tour from 8:30am–5-ish. The tour was only 5000 kyats (7 people in the tuk-tuk) plus 4000 kyats in entry fees, and it was a highlight of my stay. The room itself was perfectly fine, but nothing special; fairly standard southeast Asian fare. The breakfast on the rooftop was good (friend rice, fried noodles, toast and fruit, plus tea and coffee), and there were some great places to eat within walking distance (a thai place around the corner, the night market by the lake and Verandah Youth Community Cafe). The staff very kindly turned on the TV in the lobby for those of us who was interested in the final of the Australian Open, and they were helpful in booking taxis and getting laundry done. Show more Christine , Norway Zawgi Inn 8.9 Excellent Based on 414 reviews We reached Zawgi Inn at 4am because we had taken a night bus from Mandalay. Although we had informed them that we were going to reach their place very early, the staff was asleep when we got there. Our taxi driver woke someone up and they immediately put us in a comfy bedroom to let us sleep until the later morning when our room would be free. They even offered coffee and fruits in the morning while we had not paid for it. The staff was so lovely they did their best to make our stay a pleasant moment. Breakfast was very good, with huge avocados, coffee, toasts, jam and eggs. The room is clean, spacious and in good overall conditions. I will definitely stay again there when I go back to Inle! Show more celine , France Bike World Myanmar Bed, Breakfast & Bike Inn 8.9 Excellent Based on 210 reviews The traffic in Yangon is beyond shocking and getting to/from the downtown sights is an effort, but we would recommend Bike World to anyone. Great people and service, comfy rooms, very secure. Breakfast included was comprehensive, fresh and tasty. Homemade pizza and cheap, cold beers available in the evening. Be aware that getting downtown is not a matter of jumping on a borrowed bike. It's too far and the roads are very unsafe, even to cross (think Extreme Frogger). Instead a trishaw (rickshaw) to the train station and the slow train to town is recommended and a very worthwhile experience. If taking taxis around town, be prepared for long journeys and choked roads. Bike World is well-situated to airport and bus stations. Inya Lake is nearby, a short walk, and a quiet day relaxing here in the restaurants is sweet relief from the madness of downtown Yangon. Thank you once again for a great stay. Show more Travis , Australia Lotus Bed And Breakfast 8.6 Excellent Based on 257 reviews Although the taxi driver got a little hard time finding the hotel but overall, we had a nice stay. If you take taxi, tell the driver to go to Mahabandoola Road, 49th Street and the hotel is at the right sideof the road. The location is great too, walking distance to Sule Pagoda. When we stayed, there was a renovation going on on the next door room but the work stops at 6 and we barely in the room before it's over so, no biggie for us. The breakfast was amazing (try the Myanmar Traditional Food) and the staff showed a great support, willing to do everything to make your stay comfortable. There is a cafe right across the hotel (Black Sky - if I'm not mistaken) and try the tom yum there. Tasty! There is also a small shop under the hotel (with a super polite owner) so you can buy anything you want from there. Show more Rembulan , Indonesia Soe Ko Ko Beach House & Restaurant 7.8 Very good Based on 116 reviews I would rate the Soe Ko Ko better, would they not have chosen to increase their prices during Water Festival by more than 300%: the bungalows are very basic, never worth the 95 US$ we paid, and the extra bed was nothing more but a thin mattress on the floor, without even a blanket! The bathroom was clean, but water on the floor would not evacuate… The bungalows are located a 5 minutes walk away from the beach, but unfortunately directly on the road, with traffic noise early mornings, hardly absorbed by the thin bamboo walls. On the positive side: the staff is very friendly and they seriously try to be helpful, offering us on the first night of arrival beds, so that we could rest until our room was ready. I wish however they would be more reliable when you order a service (in our case motorbikes): they confirmed several times that there would be no problems, but then somehow forgot about it… All in all: a decent choice if you get it at a good price, but outside the peak days of Water Festival, I guess you could find more attractive places for the same price... Show more Richard , Switzerland The Vibe Inn 8.4 Excellent Based on 84 reviews Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, good breakfast, small lounge area on the top floor and a good location make the Vibe a great base in Yangon. Chinatown on the doorstep, minor train station a walk away and taxis elsewhere just 100 yards away on strand road (although the staff will happily fetch one and agree a reasonable price for you). We have stayed here a few times over our time in Myanmar, it's great to have a nice base at a reasonable price in Yangon. One star knocked off this review for facilities - it would be lovely if there was a lift, as getting to the top floor in Yangon heat can be a bit much... such a minor point at this price, but it's the only thing I can think of that isn't positive. rooms have AC as does the lounge, so at least you can cool down when you get up the stairs. Thanks Vibe, see you in a couple of weeks. Show more Geraint , United Kingdom New Wave Guest House 7.6 Very good Based on 81 reviews Old building with no heat( nights are really cold) mold in the bathroom walls, water is coming thru the floor tiles on couple of places. The staff was diligent but their standards must be not very high. I felt that it was overpriced for what it was considering next door locations are 15$ a night. The pillows are the worst. Have no idea why but my neck is just killing me after 4 nights there. If I didn't prepay I would have left after the first night. On the bright side the staff was really eager to help. Show more Stoyan , United States Nature Land Hotel 7.9 Very good Based on 153 reviews Nature Land is a great place to stay in Kalaw - it's in the perfect location, just off the beaten path, in a residential area (so you feel a bit like a local). Close to all the trekking and tour offices, but with a quick phone call a rep will come to you and discuss a possible route. Close to all the market and all the restaurants as well. The staff and owners were really friendly and helpful. They even booked our bus tickets to Inle Lake and drove us to the bus stop the day we left. The complimentary breakfast was great and served each morning at their al fresco tables around the property. The grounds and room were clean and well maintained. We had an issue with the hot water on our second night, but as soon as we told the staff they fixed the problem. Show more Cassaundra , United States Sakura Inn 9 Excellent Based on 4 reviews A Little Eco Lodge 9.3 Exceptional Based on 12 reviews Thanlwin Guest House 8.7 Excellent Based on 187 reviews Thanlwin was ok... I felt as though it was a bit of a splurge at over $20 for a night there. I stayed in the dormitory, which was standard. It's pretty small, but they provide lockers big enough for a pack. The best part of the place was there are many showers to accommodate all the guests. (only one inside the building, then a number additional bathrooms in the back). All the showers had hot water (electric). The weird thing was that when I was showering they kept having power outages. Don't know what that was about. But the staff is really friendly and helpful. The location is behind Sedona Hotel. It's a bit hard to find at first. It's nice if you want some quiet time and a really chill vibe. Show more Jasmine , United States Six Star Guest House 8.5 Excellent Based on 16 reviews Hill Garden Hotel 8 Very good Based on 218 reviews Was my first stop in Myanmar and I think I may be spoiled for the rest of my travels! Its a short 5 min, beautiful bike ride (bikes are available for about $2 a day at the hotel) along the ocean to arrive at the main beach. The sister hotel is located at the main beach and you are welcome to use the Free Wifi there. Your price includes a very good breakfast - you're given the fruit of the day, treat of the day (local sweet, very good so you should try them all), coffee or tea, your choice of eggs and toast, selection of pancakes or for a day notice you can enjoy a Myanmar traditional dish (listed on the menu, I cannot rem how to spell it), which I recommend, its delicious. There is a man that works between the two hotels relentlessly to ensure you are taken care of each day of your stay. He arranges transportation, trips, tours, extensions - you name it, he's fantastic! The only downside to this hotel for me was how long it took to get hot water to my hut. Depending on where yours is located it can take upwards of 15 mins plus. Though cool showers are quite normal in Asia and often welcomed after a very hot day of travel, so not the end of the world in my opinion. Show more Eileen , Canada Agga Guest House 7.3 Very good Based on 580 reviews I had booked a single room but brought another friend with me. Unfortunately there was no upgrades available but they had sister hotel available around the corner for a bartered price similar to what I payed. The rooms were nice and WIFI good compared to the rest of Myanmar. It was a 20-30 minute walk all the way down to Sule Pagoda and the rest of downtown but there were many local buses to take you there and it was only minutes walk to the famous 19th st. and all of the nightlife of China Town. Breakfast is similar to Vietnam hostels. 2 pieces of bread with eggs and Jam. Much better than most Thai hostels with just toast and jelly. Just don't ask the workers to help get you taxi to bus station or Airport. They get taxi and negotiate price higher than usual so they can get kickback from driver. Show more Dennis Inle Inn 8.7 Excellent Based on 101 reviews We stayed three nights with my husband in this hotel. Overall its a good hotel and we were satisfied. The room was clean big and the bed comfortable. The breakfast was good in term of quality but small and with only two choices (eggs or pain cakes). The hotel location is a bit outside but its maybe a 10min walk or 5min with the bike taxi (for app 1 $) so it was not a problem for us. The only bad point was the price of the laundry, it was extremely expensive... The most expensive prices we have had in Myanmar (and we stayed there 4weeks). The staff was friendly. Show more Melanie , Switzerland Mr Charles River View Lodge 9.1 Exceptional Based on 23 reviews Our stay at river lodge was amazing. The location near a Shan village is peaceful and relaxing. The food is delicious (try the brown sticky rice). The staff was very kind and Mimi, the daughter of Mr Charles, helped us organizing our trip in Myanmar. This is the best hotel and location in Hsipaw and we hope to come back soon. Show more Emilie , Italy Agga Bed & Breakfast 7.6 Very good Based on 133 reviews I stayed in a 8-bedroom dorm that I was really satisfied with. This room has no bunkbeds so everyone gets their own bed, which was quite big and comfy. You also get a fairly big locker and if you don't have a lock they can supply you with a key. Breakfast is fairly simple - eggs on toast, but it's enough to keep you going until lunch. The dining area is also quite nice. The staff are nice and accommodating and they will help you with everything. You can also use their printer for a cheap price. Wifi here is one of the best I had throughout Myanmar. Show more Hannah , Norway 20th Street Hostel 7.6 Very good Based on 246 reviews We arrived at the hostel earlier and couldn't check-in until 2PM. They were fully booked. The common toilet and showers in the second floor were quite dirty and old. I was very uncomfortable with this. When we finally checked in, we stayed in one of the dorm rooms which was actually very nice, clean and cozy. The bathroom in that room was very clean and neat. Breakfast was really good as they served local food and they were generous with the amount of food. The hostel's location is very convenient as it is in China Town and it was very near the long stretch of food vendors at night. Aircon was our saving grace as well. Yangon heat during our stay was unbearable. Show more Isabel , Philippines Mother's Home Motel 8.4 Excellent Based on 104 reviews The staff here was very nice and very friendly. I was jet-lagged when I arrived and couldn't sleep even after checking in quite late. I went downstairs to have a cigar and a beer but realized that I never packed a lighter or matches. The gentleman working that night didn't have a lighter or matches but was nice enough to start the car outside so I could use it's lighter. He then brought out a chair and a table for me and even brought me some fruit. This was my welcome to Myanmar. The hotel is on a pretty rough street that will be a shock to anyone unfamiliar with the third world. There is also a lot of traffic noise. The power went out constantly which is not the hotel's fault. They do have a backup generator but the constant cycling and beeping from the a/c coming back on-line made sleep tough especially with the jet-lag to deal with. The staff arranged a flight for me and my friend and helped with places to eat in the area and taxi rides. We also got them to write the name and address of the hotel in Burmese to show cab drivers when returning from sightseeing or eating out. Show more Frank , United States Mya Thida Hotel 6.7 Good Based on 535 reviews It was a little stressful when we first arrived at Mya Thida. The bus dropped us off in Bagan ~4am and after viewing the sunrise atop a temple, we were dropped off at the guest house around 6:30 am. The staff was clearly overwhelmed by the large (by the hotel's capacity standards) group that ascended at such an early hour (though I think it was fairly typical considering the popularity of overnight buses in Myanmar). My partner & I were the only ones with a reservation (booked through Agoda) though we were the last of the bunch to be accommodated. Apparently the type of room we booked was the last to become available/cleaned. The internet connection was also terrible - so slow that we weren't able to even book a stay in the next city we were traveling to. All in all, the place was nicely located & the rooms were clean and comfortable by our standards. Show more Elizabeth , United States Chan Myaye Guest House 8.2 Excellent Based on 21 reviews Mr Charles Guest House 8 Very good Based on 155 reviews My stay there was absolutely fine apart from te fact I was unfortunate enough to have a room where the common area was right outside. Despite there being a notice for quiet time after 10pm, one group totally disregarded this and were super loud and playing music until nearly 1am which meant I couldn't sleep, despite knowing I was in my room. Guess I could've gone out and asked them to be quiet, but I couldn't trust myself to be civil...! The next night was fine. The staff are lovely and helpful, and the ability to easily book hikes and buses etc easily was great. The toilets & shower were too far away, downstairs and outside in another block, but not the end of the world given I had my own little room (sparse but clean & did the job) for a very good price. Would recommend to other travellers Show more Aliye , United Kingdom Cozy Guest House 8.1 Excellent Based on 20 reviews Winner Residence 8.9 Excellent Based on 12 reviews Best Season Apartment 7.8 Very good Based on 5 reviews Vista Residence 6.3 Good Based on 8 reviews Chan Tha Gon Yaung Apartment 5.3 Review score Based on 5 reviews Rose Land Apartment Hotel 3.6 Review score Based on 1 reviews 21 Apartment 7.8 Very good Based on 8 reviews Green Acres Service Apartment 4.6 Review score Based on 1 reviews Pyay Garden Residence 9.2 Exceptional Based on 1 reviews Top cities in Myanmar 389 Cheap hotel rates are not always easy to come by, but Agoda.com features the best available rates at more than 1211 hotels in Myanmar. You can be sure to find the most up-to-date information and hotel deals here. Consisting of 14 regions, each with its own unique appeal, the country offers visitors plenty of different areas to explore. Oh and whatever you do, Yangon, Bagan, Mandalay are great cities to visit.
